page.title: 11RECREATION - CHILDREN
page.content: The playgroup meets three mornings a week in the Village Hall and about 19 3-4 year olds attend. There are no longer Brownie or Scout cub groups in the area, but a number of children join the East Meon troops. The Sunday Club, meeting each week for an hour at the Church seeks to further understanding of religious matters. 54 children belong, 35 attend regularly. On Sunday the group splits into age-based groups for crafts, teaching and discussions. The older children help to teach the younger and have their own "Pathfinder" group within the group. The leader is concerned that the children live in an area with few amenities and the club has monthly meetings for walks, outings, theatre visits, barbeques, treasure hunts etc. with the aim of usefully occupying their spare time.
